ChatServer.title: ChatServer
ChatServer.description: The suffix used to identify a non-group chat id

GroupChatServer.title: GroupChatServer
GroupChatServer.description: The suffix used to identify a group chat id

WaServers.title: WaServers
WaServers.description: A type alias for all available "servers"

CountryCode.title: CountryCode
CountryCode.description: Type alias representing all available country codes

AccountNumber.title: AccountNumber
AccountNumber.description: The account number. It is made up of a country code and then the local number without the preceeding 0. For example, if a UK (+44) wa account is linked to the number 07123456789 then the account number will be 447123456789.

GroupId.title: GroupId
GroupId.description: A new group or community has the format of a random number followed by `@g.us`

GroupChatId.title: GroupChatId
GroupChatId.description:
A group chat ends with `@g.us` and usually has two parts, the timestamp of when it was created, and the user id of the number that created the group. For example `[creator number]-[timestamp]@g.us`

Example:

`"447123456789-1445627445@g.us"`

ContactId.title: ContactId
ContactId.description:
A contact id ends with `@c.us` and only contains the number of the contact. For example, if the country code of a contact is `44` and their number is `7123456789` then the contact id would be `447123456789@c.us`

Example:

`"447123456789@c.us"`

ChatId.title: ChatId
ChatId.description:
A chat id ends with `@c.us` or `@g.us` for group chats.

Example:

A group chat: `"447123456789-1445627445@g.us"`
A group chat: `"447123456789@g.us"`

MessageId.title: MessageId
MessageId.description:
The id of a message. The format is `[boolean]_[ChatId]_[random character string]`

Example:

`"false_447123456789@c.us_9C4D0965EA5C09D591334AB6BDB07FEB"`

Content.title: Content
Content.description:
This is a generic type alias for the content of a message

Example:

`"hello!"`

DataURL.title: DataURL
DataURL.description:
Data URLs, URLs prefixed with the data: scheme, allow content creators to embed small files inline in documents. They were formerly known as "data URIs" until that name was retired by the WHATWG.


Data URLs are composed of four parts: a prefix (data:), a MIME type indicating the type of data, an optional base64 token if non-textual, and the data itself:

Example:
`"data:[<mediatype>][;base64],<data>"`

Learn more here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/Data_URIs

Base64.title: Base64
Base64.description:
Base64 is basically a file encoded as a string.

Base64 is a group of similar binary-to-text encoding schemes that represent binary data in an ASCII string format by translating it into a radix-64 representation. The term Base64 originates from a specific MIME content transfer encoding.

Learn more here: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/Base64

FilePath.title: FilePath
FilePath.description:
The relative or absolute path of a file

Learn more here: https://www.w3schools.com/html/html_filepaths.asp

GetURL.title: GetURL
GetURL.description: A URL of a file used with a GET request

AdvancedFile.title: AdvancedFile
AdvancedFile.description: Some file based actions in open-wa are powerful enough to take a dataurl, url or filepath

id.title: Call.id
id.description: The id of the call

peerJid.title: Call.peerJid
peerJid.description: The id of the account calling

offerTime.title: Call.offerTime
offerTime.description: The epoch timestamp of the call. You will have to multiply this by 1000 to get the actual epoch timestamp

isVideo.title: Call.isVideo
isVideo.description: Whether or not the call is a video call

isGroup.title: Call.isGroup
isGroup.description: Whether or not the call is a group call

participants.title: Call.participants
participants.description: The other participants on a group call

contact.title: BaseChat.contact
contact.description: The contact related to this chat

isAnnounceGrpRestrict.title: BaseChat.isAnnounceGrpRestrict
isAnnounceGrpRestrict.description: If the chat is a group chat is restricted

canSend.title: BaseChat.canSend
canSend.description: Whether your host account is able to send messages to this chat

isReadOnly.title: BaseChat.isReadOnly
isReadOnly.description: Whether the chat is a group chat and the group is restricted

labels.title: BaseChat.labels
labels.description: The labels attached to this chat.

lastReceivedKey.title: BaseChat.lastReceivedKey
lastReceivedKey.description: The ID of the last message received in this chat

muteExpiration.title: BaseChat.muteExpiration
muteExpiration.description: The expiration timestamp of the chat mute

notSpam.title: BaseChat.notSpam
notSpam.description: Whether the chat is marked as spam

pendingMsgs.title: BaseChat.pendingMsgs
pendingMsgs.description: Messages that are pending to be sent

presence.title: BaseChat.presence
presence.description: The presence state of the chat participant

t.title: BaseChat.t
t.description: The timestamp of the last interaction in the chat

unreadCount.title: BaseChat.unreadCount
unreadCount.description: The number of undread messages in this chat

isOnline.title: BaseChat.isOnline
isOnline.description: @deprecated This is unreliable. Use the method [`isChatOnline`](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#ischatonline) instead.

lastSeen.title: BaseChat.lastSeen
lastSeen.description: @deprecated This is unreliable. Use the method [`getLastSeen`](https://open-wa.github.io/wa-automate-nodejs/classes/client.html#getlastseen) instead.

pic.title: BaseChat.pic
pic.description: URL of the chat picture if available

id.title: SingleChat.id
id.description: The id of the chat

isGroup.title: SingleChat.isGroup
isGroup.description: Whether the chat is a group chat

id.title: GroupChat.id
id.description: The id of the chat

isGroup.title: GroupChat.isGroup
isGroup.description: Whether the chat is a group chat

msgId.title: LiveLocationChangedEvent.msgId
msgId.description: The message id that was sent when the liveLocation session was started.

code.title: GroupChatCreationParticipantAddResponse.code
code.description:
The resultant status code for adding the participant.

200 if the participant was added successfully during the creation of the group.

403 if the participant does not allow their account to be added to group chats. If you receive a 403, you will also get an `invite_code` and `invite_code_exp`

invite_code.title: GroupChatCreationParticipantAddResponse.invite_code
invite_code.description: If the participant is not allowed to be added to group chats due to their privacy settings, you will receive an `invite_code` which you can send to them via a text.

invite_code_exp.title: GroupChatCreationParticipantAddResponse.invite_code_exp
invite_code_exp.description:
The expiry ts of the invite_code. It is a number wrapped in a string, in order to get the proper time you can use this:

```javascript
  new Date(Number(invite_code_exp)*1000)
```

status.title: GroupChatCreationResponse.status
status.description:
The resultant status code of the group chat creation.

200 if the group was created successfully.

400 if the initial participant does not exist

participants.title: GroupChatCreationResponse.participants
participants.description: The initial requested participants and their corresponding add responses

EphemeralDuration.title: EphemeralDuration
EphemeralDuration.description: Ephemeral duration can be 1 day, 7 days or 90 days. The default is 1 day.

url.title: Webhook.url
url.description: The endpoint to send (POST) the event to.

requestConfig.title: Webhook.requestConfig

id.title: Webhook.id
id.description: The ID of the given webhook setup. Use this ID with [[removeWebhook]]

events.title: Webhook.events
events.description: An array of events that are registered to be sent to this webhook.

ts.title: Webhook.ts
ts.description: Time when the webhook was registered in epoch time

protocol.title: ProxyServerCredentials.protocol
protocol.description: The protocol on which the proxy is running. E.g `http`, `https`, `socks4` or `socks5`. This is optional and can be automatically determined from the address.

address.title: ProxyServerCredentials.address
address.description: Proxy Server address. This can include the port e.g '127.0.0.1:5005'

sessionData.title: ConfigObject.sessionData
sessionData.description:
The authentication object (as a JSON object or a base64 encoded string) that is required to migrate a session from one instance to another or to just restart an existing instance.
This sessionData is provided in a generated JSON file (it's a json file but contains the JSON data as a base64 encoded string) upon QR scan or an event.

You can capture the event like so:
```javascript
import {create, ev} from '@open-wa/wa-automate';

     ev.on('sessionData.**', async (sessionData, sessionId) =>{
         console.log(sessionId, sessionData)
     })

//or as base64 encoded string

     ev.on('sessionDataBase64.**', async (sessionDatastring, sessionId) =>{
         console.log(sessionId, sessionDatastring)
     })
```
 NOTE: You can set sessionData as an evironmental variable also! The variable name has to be [sessionId (default = 'session) in all caps]_DATA_JSON. You have to make sure to surround your session data with single quotes to maintain the formatting.

For example:

sessionId = 'session'

To set env var:
```bash
   export SESSION_DATA_JSON=`...`
```
where ... is copied from session.data.json this will be a string most likley starting in `ey...` and ending with `==`

Setting the sessionData in the environmental variable will override the sessionData object in the config.

browserWSEndpoint.title: ConfigObject.browserWSEndpoint
browserWSEndpoint.description:
ALPHA EXPERIMENTAL FEATURE! DO NOT USE IN PRODUCTION, REQUIRES TESTING.

Learn more:

https://pptr.dev/#?product=Puppeteer&version=v3.1.0&show=api-puppeteerconnectoptions

https://medium.com/@jaredpotter1/connecting-puppeteer-to-existing-chrome-window-8a10828149e0

useStealth.title: ConfigObject.useStealth
useStealth.description: This flag allows you to disable or enable the use of the puppeteer stealth plugin. It is a good idea to use it, however it can cause issues sometimes. Set this to false if you are experiencing `browser.setMaxListeneres` issue. For now the default for this is false.

sessionDataPath.title: ConfigObject.sessionDataPath
sessionDataPath.description: The path relative to the current working directory (i.e where you run the command to start your process). This will be used to store and read your `.data.json` files. defualt to ''

bypassCSP.title: ConfigObject.bypassCSP
bypassCSP.description: Disable cors see: https://pptr.dev/#?product=Puppeteer&version=v3.0.4&show=api-pagesetbypasscspenabled If you are having an issue with sending media try to set this to true. Otherwise leave it set to false.

chromiumArgs.title: ConfigObject.chromiumArgs
chromiumArgs.description:
This allows you to pass any array of custom chrome/chromium argument strings to the puppeteer instance.
You can find all possible arguements [here](https://peter.sh/experiments/chromium-command-line-switches/).

skipBrokenMethodsCheck.title: ConfigObject.skipBrokenMethodsCheck
skipBrokenMethodsCheck.description: If set to true, skipBrokenMethodsCheck will bypass the health check before startup. It is highly suggested to not set this to true.

skipUpdateCheck.title: ConfigObject.skipUpdateCheck
skipUpdateCheck.description: If set to true, `skipUpdateCheck` will bypass the latest version check. This saves some time on boot (around 150 ms).

sessionId.title: ConfigObject.sessionId
sessionId.description: This is the name of the session. You have to make sure that this is unique for every session.

licenseKey.title: ConfigObject.licenseKey
licenseKey.description:
In order to unlock the functionality to send texts to unknown numbers, you need a License key.
One License Key is valid for each number. Each License Key starts from £5 per month.

Please check README for instructions on how to get a license key.

Notes:
1. You can change the number assigned to that License Key at any time, just message me the new number on the private discord channel.
2. In order to cancel your License Key, simply stop your membership.

customUserAgent.title: ConfigObject.customUserAgent
customUserAgent.description: You may set a custom user agent. However, due to recent developments, this is not really neccessary any more.

devtools.title: ConfigObject.devtools
devtools.description:
You can enable remote devtools by setting this to trye. If you set this to true there will be security on the devtools url.
If you want, you can also pass a username & password.

blockCrashLogs.title: ConfigObject.blockCrashLogs
blockCrashLogs.description: Setting this to true will block any network calls to crash log servers. This should keep anything you do under the radar.

cacheEnabled.title: ConfigObject.cacheEnabled
cacheEnabled.description: Setting this to false turn off the cache. This may improve memory usage.

browserRevision.title: ConfigObject.browserRevision
browserRevision.description:
This is the specific browser revision to be downlaoded and used. You can find browser revision strings here: http://omahaproxy.appspot.com/
Learn more about it here: https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/blob/master/docs/api.md#class-browserfetcher
If you're having trouble with sending images, try '737027'.
If you go too far back things will start breaking !!!!!!
NOTE: THIS WILL OVERRIDE useChrome and executablePath. ONLY USE THIS IF YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING.

throwErrorOnTosBlock.title: ConfigObject.throwErrorOnTosBlock
throwErrorOnTosBlock.description: Setting this to true will throw an error if a session is not able to get a QR code or is unable to restart a session.

headless.title: ConfigObject.headless
headless.description: By default, all instances of @open-wa/wa-automate are headless (i.e you don't see a chrome window open), you can set this to false to show the chrome/chromium window.

autoRefresh.title: ConfigObject.autoRefresh
autoRefresh.description:
@deprecated THIS IS LOCKED TO `true` AND CANNOT BE TURNED OFF. PLEASE SEE [[authTimeout]]

Setting this to true will result in new QR codes being generated if the end user takes too long to scan the QR code.

qrRefreshS.title: ConfigObject.qrRefreshS
qrRefreshS.description:
@deprecated This now has no effect

This determines the interval at which to refresh the QR code. By default, WA updates the qr code every 18-19 seconds so make sure this value is set to UNDER 18 seconds!!

qrTimeout.title: ConfigObject.qrTimeout
qrTimeout.description: This determines how long the process should wait for a QR code to be scanned before killing the process entirely. To have the system wait continuously, set this to `0`.

waitForRipeSessionTimeout.title: ConfigObject.waitForRipeSessionTimeout
waitForRipeSessionTimeout.description:
This determines how long the process should wait for a session to load fully before continuing the launch process.
Set this to 0 to wait forever. Default is 5 seconds.

executablePath.title: ConfigObject.executablePath
executablePath.description: Some features, like video upload, do not work without a chrome instance. Set this to the path of your chrome instance or you can use `useChrome:true` to automatically detect a chrome instance for you. Please note, this overrides `useChrome`.

useChrome.title: ConfigObject.useChrome
useChrome.description: If true, the program will automatically try to detect the instance of chorme on the machine. Please note this DOES NOT override executablePath.

proxyServerCredentials.title: ConfigObject.proxyServerCredentials
proxyServerCredentials.description: If sent, adds a call to waPage.authenticate with those credentials. Set `corsFix` to true if using a proxy results in CORS errors.

qrLogSkip.title: ConfigObject.qrLogSkip
qrLogSkip.description: If true, skips logging the QR Code to the console.

restartOnCrash.title: ConfigObject.restartOnCrash

disableSpins.title: ConfigObject.disableSpins
disableSpins.description: Setting this to true will simplify logs for use within docker containers by disabling spins (will still print raw messages).

logConsole.title: ConfigObject.logConsole
logConsole.description: If true, this will log any console messages from the browser.

logConsoleErrors.title: ConfigObject.logConsoleErrors
logConsoleErrors.description: If true, this will log any error messages from the browser instance

authTimeout.title: ConfigObject.authTimeout
authTimeout.description: This determines how long the process should wait for the session authentication. If exceeded, checks if phone is out of reach (turned of or without internet connection) and throws an error. It does not relate to the amount of time spent waiting for a qr code scan (see [[qrTimeout]]). To have the system wait continuously, set this to `0`.

killProcessOnBrowserClose.title: ConfigObject.killProcessOnBrowserClose
killProcessOnBrowserClose.description: Setting this to `true` will kill the whole process when the client is disconnected from the page or if the browser is closed.

safeMode.title: ConfigObject.safeMode
safeMode.description: If true, client will check if the page is valid before each command. If page is not valid, it will throw an error.

skipSessionSave.title: ConfigObject.skipSessionSave
skipSessionSave.description: If true, the process will not save a data.json file. This means that sessions will not be saved and you will need to pass sessionData as a config param or create the session data.json file yourself

popup.title: ConfigObject.popup
popup.description:
If true, the process will open a browser window where you will see basic event logs and QR codes to authenticate the session. Usually it will open on port 3000. It can also be set to a preferred port.

You can also get the QR code png at (if localhost and port 3000):

`http://localhost:3000/qr`

or if you have multiple session:

 `http://localhost:3000/qr?sessionId=[sessionId]`

qrPopUpOnly.title: ConfigObject.qrPopUpOnly
qrPopUpOnly.description:
This needs to be used in conjuction with `popup`, if `popup` is not true or a number (representing a desired port) then this will not work.

Setting this to true will make sure that only the qr code png is served via the web server. This is useful if you do not need the whole status page.

As mentioned in [popup](#popup), the url for the qr code is `http://localhost:3000/qr` if the port is 3000.

inDocker.title: ConfigObject.inDocker
inDocker.description:
If true, the process will try infer as many config variables as possible from the environment variables. The format of the variables are as below:
```
sessionData     ==>     WA_SESSION_DATA
sessionDataPath ==>     WA_SESSION_DATA_PATH
sessionId       ==>     WA_SESSION_ID
customUserAgent ==>     WA_CUSTOM_USER_AGENT
blockCrashLogs  ==>     WA_BLOCK_CRASH_LOGS
blockAssets     ==>     WA_BLOCK_ASSETS
corsFix         ==>     WA_CORS_FIX
cacheEnabled    ==>     WA_CACHE_ENABLED
headless        ==>     WA_HEADLESS
qrTimeout       ==>     WA_QR_TIMEOUT
useChrome       ==>     WA_USE_CHROME
qrLogSkip       ==>     WA_QR_LOG_SKIP
disableSpins    ==>     WA_DISABLE_SPINS
logConsole      ==>     WA_LOG_CONSOLE
logConsoleErrors==>     WA_LOG_CONSOLE_ERRORS
authTimeout     ==>     WA_AUTH_TIMEOUT
safeMode        ==>     WA_SAFE_MODE
skipSessionSave ==>     WA_SKIP_SESSION_SAVE
popup           ==>     WA_POPUP
licensekey      ==>     WA_LICENSE_KEY
```

qrQuality.title: ConfigObject.qrQuality
qrQuality.description: The output quality of the qr code during authentication. This can be any increment of 0.1 from 0.1 to 1.0.

qrFormat.title: ConfigObject.qrFormat
qrFormat.description: The output format of the qr code. `png`, `jpeg` or `webm`.

hostNotificationLang.title: ConfigObject.hostNotificationLang
hostNotificationLang.description: The language of the host notification. See: https://github.com/open-wa/wa-automate-nodejs/issues/709#issuecomment-673419088

blockAssets.title: ConfigObject.blockAssets
blockAssets.description: Setting this to true will block all assets from loading onto the page. This may result in some load time improvements but also increases instability.

keepUpdated.title: ConfigObject.keepUpdated
keepUpdated.description:
[ALPHA FEATURE - ONLY IMPLEMENTED FOR TESTING - DO NOT USE IN PRODUCTION YET]
Setting this to true will result in the library making sure it is always starting with the latest version of itself. This overrides `skipUpdateCheck`.

resizable.title: ConfigObject.resizable
resizable.description: Syncs the viewport size with the window size which is how normal browsers act. Only relevant when `headless: false` and this overrides `viewport` config.

viewport.title: ConfigObject.viewport
viewport.description: Set the desired viewport height and width. For CLI, use [width]x[height] format. E.g `--viewport 1920x1080`.

legacy.title: ConfigObject.legacy
legacy.description: As the library is constantly evolving, some parts will be replaced with more efficient and improved code. In some of the infinite edge cases these new changes may not work for you. Set this to true to roll back on 'late beta' features. The reason why legacy is false by default is that in order for features to be tested they have to be released and used by everyone to find the edge cases and fix them.

deleteSessionDataOnLogout.title: ConfigObject.deleteSessionDataOnLogout
deleteSessionDataOnLogout.description: Deletes the session data file (if found) on logout event. This results in a quicker login when you restart the process.

killProcessOnTimeout.title: ConfigObject.killProcessOnTimeout
killProcessOnTimeout.description: If set to true, the system will kill the whole node process when either an [[authTimeout]] or a [[qrTimeout]] has been reached. This is useful to prevent hanging processes.

killProcessOnBan.title: ConfigObject.killProcessOnBan
killProcessOnBan.description:
If set to true, the system will kill the whole node process when a "TEMPORARY BAN" is detected. This is useful to prevent hanging processes.
It is `true` by default because it is a very rare event and it is better to kill the process than to leave it hanging.

corsFix.title: ConfigObject.corsFix
corsFix.description: Setting this to true will bypass web security. DO NOT DO THIS IF YOU DO NOT HAVE TO. CORS issue may arise when using a proxy.

callTimeout.title: ConfigObject.callTimeout
callTimeout.description:
Amount of time (in ms) to wait for a client method (specifically methods that interact with the WA web session) to resolve. If a client method results takes longer than the timout value then it will result in a [[PageEvaluationTimeout]] error.

If you get this error, it does not automatically mean that the method failed - it just stops your program from waiting for a client method to resolve.

This is useful if you do not rely on the results of a client method (e.g the message ID).

If set to `0`, the process will wait indefinitely for a client method to resolve.

screenshotOnInitializationBrowserError.title: ConfigObject.screenshotOnInitializationBrowserError
screenshotOnInitializationBrowserError.description: When true, this option will take a screenshot of the browser when an unexpected error occurs within the browser during `create` initialization. The path will be `[working directory]/logs/[session ID]/[start timestamp]/[timestamp].jpg`

eventMode.title: ConfigObject.eventMode
eventMode.description:
Setting listeners may not be your cup of tea. With eventMode, all [[SimpleListener]] events will be registered automatically and be filed via the built in Events Listener.

This is useful because you can register/deregister the event listener as needed whereas the legacy method of setting callbacks are only be set once

logFile.title: ConfigObject.logFile
logFile.description:
If true, the system will automatically create a log of all processes relating to actions sent to the web session.

The location of the file will be relative to the process directory (pd)

`[pd]/[sessionId]/[start timestamp].log`

idCorrection.title: ConfigObject.idCorrection
idCorrection.description: When true, the system will attempt to correct chatIds and groupChatIds. This means you can ignore `@c.us` and `@g.us` distinctions in some parameters.

stickerServerEndpoint.title: ConfigObject.stickerServerEndpoint
stickerServerEndpoint.description: Redundant until self-hostable sticker server is available.

ghPatch.title: ConfigObject.ghPatch
ghPatch.description: This will force the library to use the default cached raw github link for patches to shave a few hundred milliseconds from your launch time. If you use this option, you will need to wait about 5 minutes before trying out new patches.

cachedPatch.title: ConfigObject.cachedPatch
cachedPatch.description: Setting this to `true` will save a local copy of the patches.json file (as patches.ignore.data.json) which will be used in subsequent instantiations of the session. While the rest of the launch procedure is running, the library will fetch and save a recent version of the patches to ensure your patches don't go stale. This will be ignored if the cached patches are more than a day old.

logDebugInfoAsObject.title: ConfigObject.logDebugInfoAsObject
logDebugInfoAsObject.description: Setting `this` to true will replace the `console.table` with a stringified logging of the debug info object instead. This would be useful to set for smaller terminal windows. If `disableSpins` is `true` then this will also be `true`.

logInternalEvents.title: ConfigObject.logInternalEvents
logInternalEvents.description: This will make the library log all internal wa web events to the console. This is useful for debugging purposes. DO NOT TURN THIS ON UNLESS ASKED TO.

killClientOnLogout.title: ConfigObject.killClientOnLogout
killClientOnLogout.description: Kill the client when a logout is detected

throwOnExpiredSessionData.title: ConfigObject.throwOnExpiredSessionData
throwOnExpiredSessionData.description:
This will make the `create` command return `false` if the detected session data is expired.

This will mean, the process will not attempt to automatically get a new QR code.

useNativeProxy.title: ConfigObject.useNativeProxy
useNativeProxy.description: Some sessions may experience issues with sending media when using proxies. Using the native proxy system instead of the recommended 3rd party library may fix these issues.

raspi.title: ConfigObject.raspi
raspi.description:
Set this to `true` to make the library work on Raspberry Pi OS.

Make sure to run the following command before running the library the first time:

```
> sudo apt update -y && sudo apt install chromium-browser chromium-codecs-ffmpeg -y && sudo apt upgrade
```

If you're using the CLI, you can set this value to `true` by adding the following flag to the CLI command

```
> npx @open-wa/wa-automate ... --raspi
```

pQueueDefault.title: ConfigObject.pQueueDefault
pQueueDefault.description:
Default pqueue options applied to all listeners that can take pqueue options as a second optional parameter. For now, this only includes `onMessage` and `onAnyMessage`.

See: https://github.com/sindresorhus/p-queue#options

Example: process 5 events within every 3 seconds window. Make sure to only process at most 2 at any one time. Make sure there is at least 100ms between each event processing.

```javascript
    {
        intervalCap: 5, //process 5 events
        interval: 3000, //within every three second window
        concurrency: 2, //make sure to process, at most, 2 events at any one time
        timeout: 100, //make sure there is a 100ms gap between each event processing.
        carryoverConcurrencyCount: true //If there are more than 5 events in that period, process them within the next 3 second period. Make sure this is always set to true!!!
    }
```

messagePreprocessor.title: ConfigObject.messagePreprocessor
messagePreprocessor.description:
Set a preprocessor, or multiple chained preprocessors, for messages. See [MPConfigType](/) for more info.

options: `SCRUB`, `BODY_ONLY`, `AUTO_DECRYPT`, `AUTO_DECRYPT_SAVE`, `UPLOAD_CLOUD`.

preprocFilter.title: ConfigObject.preprocFilter
preprocFilter.description:
Set an array filter to be used with messagePreprocessor to limit which messages are preprocessed.

E.g if you want to scrub all messages that are not from a group, you can do the following:
`"m=>!m.isGroupMsg"`

accessKeyId.title: ConfigObject.cloudUploadOptions.accessKeyId
accessKeyId.description:
S3 compatible access key ID.

e.g: `AKIAIOSFODNN7EXAMPLE` or `GOOGTS7C7FUP3AIRVJTE2BCD`

env: `OW_CLOUD_ACCESS_KEY_ID`

secretAccessKey.title: ConfigObject.cloudUploadOptions.secretAccessKey
secretAccessKey.description:
S3 compatible secret access key.

e.g `wJalrXUtnFEMI/K7MDENG/bPxRfiCYEXAMPLEKEY`

env: `OW_CLOUD_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY`

region.title: ConfigObject.cloudUploadOptions.region
region.description:
Bucket region.

Not required for `GCP` provider

env: `OW_CLOUD_REGION`

ignoreHostAccount.title: ConfigObject.cloudUploadOptions.ignoreHostAccount
ignoreHostAccount.description:
Ignore processing of messages that are sent by the host account itself

env: `OW_CLOUD_IGNORE_HOST`

directory.title: ConfigObject.cloudUploadOptions.directory
directory.description:
The directory strategy to use when uploading files. Or just set it to a custom directory string.

env: `OW_DIRECTORY`

public.title: ConfigObject.cloudUploadOptions.public
public.description: Setting this to true will make the uploaded file public

headers.title: ConfigObject.cloudUploadOptions.headers
headers.description: Extra headers to add to the upload request

cloudUploadOptions.title: ConfigObject.cloudUploadOptions
cloudUploadOptions.description:
REQUIRED IF `messagePreprocessor` IS SET TO `UPLOAD_CLOUD`.

This can be set via the config or the corresponding environment variables.

onError.title: ConfigObject.onError
onError.description: What to do when an error is detected on a client method.

multiDevice.title: ConfigObject.multiDevice
multiDevice.description:
Please note that multi-device is still in beta so a lot of things may not work. It is HIGHLY suggested to NOT use this in production!!!!

Set this to true if you're using the multidevice beta.
multiDevice.default:
`true`
:::danger
Some features (e.g [[sendLinkWithAutoPreview]])  **do not** work with multi-device beta. Check [this `api`](#).
:::

sessionDataBucketAuth.title: ConfigObject.sessionDataBucketAuth
sessionDataBucketAuth.description: Base64 encoded S3 Bucket & Authentication object for session data files. The object should be in the same format as cloudUploadOptions.

autoEmoji.title: ConfigObject.autoEmoji
autoEmoji.description: Set the automatic emoji detection character. Set this to `false` to disable auto emoji. Default is `:`.

maxChats.title: ConfigObject.maxChats
maxChats.description: Set the maximum amount of chats to be present in a session.

maxMessages.title: ConfigObject.maxMessages
maxMessages.description: Set the maximum amount of messages to be present in a session.

discord.title: ConfigObject.discord
discord.description: Your Discord ID to get onto the sticker leaderboard!

ignoreNuke.title: ConfigObject.ignoreNuke
ignoreNuke.description: Don't implicitly determine if the host logged out.

ensureHeadfulIntegrity.title: ConfigObject.ensureHeadfulIntegrity
ensureHeadfulIntegrity.description:
Makes sure the headless session is usable even on first login.
Headful sessions are ususally only usable on reauthentication.

waitForRipeSession.title: ConfigObject.waitForRipeSession
waitForRipeSession.description:
wait for a valid headful session. Not required in recent versions.
default: `true`

qrMax.title: ConfigObject.qrMax
qrMax.description: Automatically kill the process after a set amount of qr codes

ezqr.title: ConfigObject.ezqr
ezqr.description: Expose a URL where you can easily scan the qr code

logging.title: ConfigObject.logging
logging.description:
An array of [winston](https://github.com/winstonjs/winston/blob/master/docs/transports.md#additional-transports) logging transport configurations.

[Check this discussion to see how to set up logging](https://github.com/open-wa/wa-automate-nodejs/discussions/2373)

linkParser.title: ConfigObject.linkParser
linkParser.description:
The URL of your instance of [serverless meta grabber](https://github.com/RemiixInc/meta-grabber-serverless) by [RemiixInc](https://github.com/RemiixInc).

default: `https://link.openwa.cloud/api`

aggressiveGarbageCollection.title: ConfigObject.aggressiveGarbageCollection
aggressiveGarbageCollection.description:
Setting this to true will run `gc()` on before every command sent to the browser.

This is experimental and may not work or it may have unforeseen sideeffects.

id.title: BusinessProfile.id
id.description: The Contact ID of the business

tag.title: BusinessProfile.tag
tag.description: Some special string that identifies the business (?)

website.title: BusinessProfile.website
website.description: Array of strings that represent the business' websites

businessHours.title: BusinessProfile.businessHours
businessHours.description: The operating hours of the business

catalogStatus.title: BusinessProfile.catalogStatus
catalogStatus.description: The status of the business' catalog

fbPage.title: BusinessProfile.fbPage
fbPage.description: The facebook page of the business

igProfessional.title: BusinessProfile.igProfessional
igProfessional.description: The instagram profile of the business

id.title: BusinessProfile.coverPhoto.id
id.description: The id of the cover photo

url.title: BusinessProfile.coverPhoto.url
url.description: The URL of the cover photo. It might download as an .enc but just change the extension to .jpg

latitude.title: BusinessProfile.latitude
latitude.description: The latitude of the business location if set

longitude.title: BusinessProfile.longitude
longitude.description: The longitude of the business location if set

isEnterprise.title: Contact.isEnterprise
isEnterprise.description: Most likely true when the account has a green tick. See `verifiedLevel` also.

verifiedLevel.title: Contact.verifiedLevel
verifiedLevel.description:
0 = not verified
2 = verified (most likely represents a blue tick)

verifiedName.title: Contact.verifiedName
verifiedName.description: The business account name verified by WA.

businessProfile.title: Contact.businessProfile
businessProfile.description:
If the contact is a business, the business information will be added to the contact object.

In some circumstances this will be out of date or lacking certain fields. In those cases you have to use `client.getBusinessProfile`

id.title: GroupMetadata.id
id.description: The chat id of the group [[GroupChatId]]

creation.title: GroupMetadata.creation
creation.description: The timestamp of when the group was created

owner.title: GroupMetadata.owner
owner.description: The id of the owner of the group [[ContactId]]

participants.title: GroupMetadata.participants
participants.description: An array of participants in the group

descOwner.title: GroupMetadata.descOwner
descOwner.description: The account that set the description last.

isParentGroup.title: GroupMetadata.isParentGroup
isParentGroup.description: Is this group a parent group (a.k.a community)

defaultSubgroup.title: GroupMetadata.defaultSubgroup
defaultSubgroup.description: Communities have a default group chat

joinedSubgroups.title: GroupMetadata.joinedSubgroups
joinedSubgroups.description: List of Group IDs that the host account has joined as part of this community

NewCommunityGroup.title: NewCommunityGroup
NewCommunityGroup.description: Used when creating a new community with.

author.title: GenericGroupChangeEvent.author
author.description: The contact who triggered this event. (E.g the contact who changed the group picture)

body.title: GenericGroupChangeEvent.body
body.description: Some more information about the event

id.title: Label.id
id.description: The internal ID of the label. Usually a number represented as a string e.g "1"

name.title: Label.name
name.description: The text contents of the label

type.title: Label.items.[].type
type.description: Labels can be applied to chats, contacts or individual messages. This represents the type of object the label is attached to.

id.title: Label.items.[].id
id.description: The ID of the object that the label is atteched to.

items.title: Label.items
items.description: The items that are tagged with this label

removebg.title: StickerMetadata.removebg
removebg.description:
ALPHA FEATURE - NO GUARANTEES IT WILL WORK AS EXPECTED:

[REQUIRES AN INSIDERS LICENSE-KEY](https://gum.co/open-wa?tier=Insiders%20Program)

Attempt to remove the background of the sticker. Only valid for paid licenses.

options:

 `true`  - remove background after resizing

 `HQ`    - remove background before resizing (i.e on original photo)

keepScale.title: StickerMetadata.keepScale
keepScale.description: Setting this to `true` will skip the resizing/square-cropping of the sticker. It will instead 'letterbox' the image with a transparent background.

circle.title: StickerMetadata.circle
circle.description: Applies a circular mask to the sticker. Works on images only for now.

discord.title: StickerMetadata.discord
discord.description: Your Discord ID to get onto the sticker leaderboard!

cornerRadius.title: StickerMetadata.cornerRadius

fps.title: Mp4StickerConversionProcessOptions.fps
fps.description: Desired Frames per second of the sticker output

startTime.title: Mp4StickerConversionProcessOptions.startTime
startTime.description: The video start time of the sticker

endTime.title: Mp4StickerConversionProcessOptions.endTime
endTime.description: The video end time of the sticker. By default, stickers are made from the first 5 seconds of the video

loop.title: Mp4StickerConversionProcessOptions.loop
loop.description:
The amount of times the video loops in the sticker. To save processing time, leave this as 0
default `0`

crop.title: Mp4StickerConversionProcessOptions.crop
crop.description:
Centres and crops the video.
default `true`

log.title: Mp4StickerConversionProcessOptions.log
log.description: Prints ffmpeg logs in the terminal

square.title: Mp4StickerConversionProcessOptions.square
square.description:
A number representing the WxH of the output sticker (default `512x512`). Lowering this number is a great way to process longer duration stickers. The max value is `512`.
default `512`

selectedButtonId.title: Message.selectedButtonId
selectedButtonId.description: The ID of the selected button

id.title: Message.id
id.description:
The id of the message. Consists of the Chat ID and a unique string.

Example:

```
false_447123456789@c.us_7D914FEA78BE10277743F4B785045C37
```

mId.title: Message.mId
mId.description:
The unique segment of the message id.

Example:

```
7D914FEA78BE10277743F4B785045C37
```

body.title: Message.body
body.description: The body of the message. If the message type is `chat` , `body` will be the text of the chat. If the message type is some sort of media, then this body will be the thumbnail of the media.

text.title: Message.text
text.description: a convenient way to get the main text content from a message.

type.title: Message.type
type.description: The type of the message, see [[MessageTypes]]

filehash.title: Message.filehash
filehash.description: Used to checking the integrity of the decrypted media.

lat.title: Message.lat
lat.description: The latitude of a location message

lng.title: Message.lng
lng.description: The longitude of a location message

loc.title: Message.loc
loc.description: The text associated with a location message

from.title: Message.from
from.description: The chat from which the message was sent

to.title: Message.to
to.description: The chat id to which the message is being sent

self.title: Message.self
self.description:
Indicates whether the message is coming into the session or going out of the session. You can have a message sent by the host account show as `in` when the message was sent from another
session or from the host account device itself.

duration.title: Message.duration
duration.description: The length of the media in the message, if it exists.

ack.title: Message.ack
ack.description: The acknolwedgement state of a message [[MessageAck]]

broadcast.title: Message.broadcast
broadcast.description: If the message is sent as a broadcast

isForwarded.title: Message.isForwarded
isForwarded.description: If the message has been forwarded

labels.title: Message.labels
labels.description: The labels associated with the message (used with business accounts)

mentionedJidList.title: Message.mentionedJidList
mentionedJidList.description: An array of all mentioned numbers in this message.

caption.title: Message.caption
caption.description: If the message is of a media type, it may also have a caption

sender.title: Message.sender
sender.description: The contact object of the account that sent the message

filePath.title: Message.filePath
filePath.description:
When `config.messagePreprocessor: "AUTO_DECRYPT_SAVE"` is set, media is decrypted and saved on disk in a folder called media relative to the current working directory.

This is the filePath of the decrypted file.

filename.title: Message.filename
filename.description: The given filename of the file

fromMe.title: Message.fromMe
fromMe.description: If the message is from the host account

clientUrl.title: Message.clientUrl
clientUrl.description: @deprecated Ironically, you should be using `deprecatedMms3Url` instead

isQuotedMsgAvailable.title: Message.isQuotedMsgAvailable
isQuotedMsgAvailable.description: If this message is quoting (replying to) another message

isGroupJoinRequest.title: Message.isGroupJoinRequest
isGroupJoinRequest.description:
When a user requests to join a group wihtin a community the request is received by the host as a message. This boolean will allow you to easily determine if the incoming message is a request to join a group.

If this is `true` then you need to determine within your own code whether or not to accept the user to the group which is indicated with `quotedRemoteJid` using `addParticipant`.

senderId.title: Message.senderId
senderId.description: The ID of the message sender

quotedRemoteJid.title: Message.quotedRemoteJid
quotedRemoteJid.description: The ID of the quoted group. Usually present when a user is requesting to join a group.

quotedParentGroupJid.title: Message.quotedParentGroupJid
quotedParentGroupJid.description: The parent group ID (community ID - communities are just groups made up of other groups) of the group represented by `quotedRemoteJid`

isViewOnce.title: Message.isViewOnce
isViewOnce.description: Is the message a "view once" message

quoteMap.title: Message.quoteMap
quoteMap.description: Use this to traverse the quote chain.

cloudUrl.title: Message.cloudUrl
cloudUrl.description: The URL of the file after being uploaded to the cloud using a cloud upload message preprocessor.

listResponse.title: Message.listResponse
listResponse.description: List response associated with the message

list.title: Message.list
list.description: The list associated with the list message

reactionByMe.title: Message.reactionByMe
reactionByMe.description: The reaction of the host account to this message

hasReactionByMe.title: Message.reactions.[].hasReactionByMe
hasReactionByMe.description: If the host account has reacted to this message with this reaction

id.title: Message.reactions.[].id
id.description: The message ID of the reaction itself

parentMsgKey.title: ReactionSender.parentMsgKey
parentMsgKey.description: The ID of the message being reacted to

senderUserJid.title: ReactionSender.senderUserJid
senderUserJid.description: The contact ID of the sender of the reaction

msgKey.title: ReactionSender.msgKey
msgKey.description: The message ID of the reaction itself

id.title: ReactionSender.id
id.description: The message ID of the reaction itself

totalVotes.title: PollData.totalVotes
totalVotes.description: The total amount of votes recorded so far

pollOptions.title: PollData.pollOptions
pollOptions.description: The poll options and their respective count of votes.

pollMessage.title: PollData.pollMessage
pollMessage.description: The message object of the poll

id.title: PollVote.id
id.description: The message ID of this vote. For some reason this is different from the msgKey and includes exclamaition marks.

msgKey.title: PollVote.msgKey
msgKey.description: The message key of this vote

parentMsgKey.title: PollVote.parentMsgKey
parentMsgKey.description: The Message ID of the original Poll message

pollOptions.title: PollVote.pollOptions
pollOptions.description: The original poll options available on the poll

selectedOptionLocalIds.title: PollVote.selectedOptionLocalIds
selectedOptionLocalIds.description: The selected option IDs of the voter

selectedOptionValues.title: PollVote.selectedOptionValues
selectedOptionValues.description: The selected option values by this voter

sender.title: PollVote.sender
sender.description: The contact ID of the voter

senderObj.title: PollVote.senderObj
senderObj.description: The contact object of the voter

quotes.title: quotes
quotes.description: The message ID of the message that was quoted. Null if no message was quoted.

id.title: MessageInfoInteraction.id
id.description: The contact ID of the contact that interacted with the message.

t.title: MessageInfoInteraction.t
t.description: The timestamp of the interaction. You have to x 1000 to use in a JS Date object.

id.title: MessageInfo.id
id.description: The ID of the message

name.title: CustomProduct.name
name.description:
The main title of the product. E.g:
`BAVARIA — 35 SPORTS CRUISER (2006)`

description.title: CustomProduct.description
description.description:
The description of the product. This shows right under the price so it is useful for subscriptions/rentals. E.g:

`(per day)

Come and have a fantastic sailing adventure aboard our boat. 
She is a Bavaria 35 sports cruiser and is powered by 2 economical Volvo D6’s with Bravo 2 outdrives as well as a bow thruster. This Makes maneuvering very easy. She can accommodate up to 8 people for day charters and for overnight charters she can accommodate 4 in comfort in 2 cabins.`

priceAmount1000.title: CustomProduct.priceAmount1000
priceAmount1000.description:
The price amount multiplied by 1000. For example, for something costing `825` units of currency:
`825000`

currency.title: CustomProduct.currency
currency.description:
The [**ISO 4217**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) 3 letter currency code. E.g (Swedish krona)
`SEK`

url.title: CustomProduct.url
url.description:
The URL of the product.

NOTE: At the moment, the URL DOES NOT WORK. It shows up for the recipient but they will not be able to click it. As a rememdy, it is added as a reply to the product message.

id.title: CartItem.id
id.description: Product ID

qty.title: CartItem.qty
qty.description: Amount of this item in the cart

thumbnailUrl.title: CartItem.thumbnailUrl
thumbnailUrl.description: URL to .enc file of the thumbnail. Just change the filetype to .jpg to view the thumbnail

id.title: Product.id
id.description: Product ID

isHidden.title: Product.isHidden
isHidden.description: `true` if the product is hidden from public view.

catalogWid.title: Product.catalogWid
catalogWid.description: The id of the catalog in which this product is located.

availability.title: Product.availability
availability.description: The availiable quantity of this product.

reviewStatus.title: Product.reviewStatus
reviewStatus.description: The review status of the product

imageCdnUrl.title: Product.imageCdnUrl
imageCdnUrl.description:
The url of the main image of the product.

NOTE: If downloading manually, the filetype must be changed to .jpg to view the image.

imageCount.title: Product.imageCount
imageCount.description: The number of images of the product.

additionalImageCdnUrl.title: Product.additionalImageCdnUrl
additionalImageCdnUrl.description: Array of URLs of the other images of the product. Does not include the main image.

priceAmount1000.title: Product.priceAmount1000
priceAmount1000.description: The price of the product in 1000 units.

retailerId.title: Product.retailerId
retailerId.description: The custom id of the product.

t.title: Product.t
t.description: The timestamp when the product was created / 1000

currency.title: Product.currency
currency.description:
The [**ISO 4217**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) 3 letter currency code. E.g (Swedish krona)
`SEK`

id.title: Order.id
id.description: Order ID

currency.title: Order.currency
currency.description:
The [**ISO 4217**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) 3 letter currency code. E.g (Swedish krona)
`SEK`

products.title: Order.products
products.description: An array of items in the cart

message.title: Order.message
message.description: The message object associated with the order. Only populated in `onOrder` callback.

aggregateEmoji.title: Reaction.aggregateEmoji
aggregateEmoji.description: The aggregate emoji used for the reaction.

id.title: Reaction.id
id.description: The identifier of the reaction

hasReactionByMe.title: Reaction.hasReactionByMe
hasReactionByMe.description: If the reaction is also sent by the host account

senders.title: Reaction.senders
senders.description: The senders of this spefcific reaction

Reaction.title: Reaction
Reaction.description: A reaction is identified the specific emoji.

id.title: ReactionRecord.id
id.description: The ID of the reaction

read.title: ReactionRecord.read
read.description: If the reaction has been read

senderUserJid.title: ReactionRecord.senderUserJid
senderUserJid.description: The ID of the reaction sender

ReactionRecord.title: ReactionRecord
ReactionRecord.description: The specific reaction by a user

reactionByMe.title: ReactionEvent.reactionByMe
reactionByMe.description: The reaction sent by the host account

type.title: ReactionEvent.type
type.description: The type of the reaction event.

queuedMessages.title: HealthCheck.queuedMessages
queuedMessages.description:
The number of messages queued up in the browser. Messages can start being queued up due to the web app awaiting a connection with the host device.

Healthy: 0

state.title: HealthCheck.state
state.description:
The state of the web app.

Healthy: 'CONNECTED'

isPhoneDisconnected.title: HealthCheck.isPhoneDisconnected
isPhoneDisconnected.description:
Whether or not the "Phone is disconnected" message is showing within the web app.

Healthy: `false`

isHere.title: HealthCheck.isHere
isHere.description:
Returns `true` if "Use Here" button is not detected

Healthy: `true`

wapiInjected.title: HealthCheck.wapiInjected
wapiInjected.description:
Returns `true` if the `WAPI` object is detected.

Healthy: `true`

tryingToReachPhone.title: HealthCheck.tryingToReachPhone
tryingToReachPhone.description:
Returns `true` if "trying to reach phone" dialog is detected

Healthy: `false`

retryingIn.title: HealthCheck.retryingIn
retryingIn.description:
Returns the number of seconds the "Retrying in ..." dialog is indicating. If the dialog is not showing, it will return `0`.

Healthy: `0`

batteryLow.title: HealthCheck.batteryLow
batteryLow.description:
Returns `true` if "Phone battery low" message is detected

Healthy: `false`

chatwootUrl.title: ChatwootConfig.chatwootUrl
chatwootUrl.description: The URL of the chatwoot inbox. If you want this integration to create & manage the inbox for you, you can omit the inbox part.

chatwootApiAccessToken.title: ChatwootConfig.chatwootApiAccessToken
chatwootApiAccessToken.description: The API access token which you can get from your account menu.

apiHost.title: ChatwootConfig.apiHost
apiHost.description: The API host which will be used as the webhook address in the Chatwoot inbox.

https.title: ChatwootConfig.https
https.description: Whether or not to use https for the webhook address

key.title: ChatwootConfig.key
key.description: The API key used to secure the instance webhook address

forceUpdateCwWebhook.title: ChatwootConfig.forceUpdateCwWebhook
forceUpdateCwWebhook.description: Whether or not to update the webhook address in the Chatwoot inbox on launch

type.title: ConfigLogTransport.type
type.description: The type of winston transport. At the moment only `file`, `console`, `ev` and `syslog` are supported.

options.title: ConfigLogTransport.options
options.description: The options for the transport. Generally only required for syslog but you can use this to override default options for other types of transports.

done.title: ConfigLogTransport.done
done.description: If the transport has already been added to the logger. The logging set up command handles this for you.

maxProcessed.title: CollectorOptions.maxProcessed
maxProcessed.description: The maximum amount of items to process

max.title: CollectorOptions.max
max.description: The maximum amount of items to collect

time.title: CollectorOptions.time
time.description: Max time to wait for items in milliseconds

dispose.title: CollectorOptions.dispose
dispose.description: Whether to dispose data when it's deleted

CollectorOptions.title: CollectorOptions
CollectorOptions.description: Options to be applied to the collector.

errors.title: AwaitMessagesOptions.errors
errors.description: An array of "reasons" that would result in the awaitMessages command to throw an error.

MessagePreProcessor.title: MessagePreProcessor
